summary: WishMint is evolving from a form-based birthday generator into an AI Creative Card Studio: users can enter freeform prompts to generate professional multi-event invitation/greeting cards (message + layout + style + visual theme), with editable outputs, multiple variations, and optional premium upgrades while retaining a quick form mode.
architectural_notes: Design UX to avoid confusion between Quick Form Mode and Prompt Mode (clear entry points and naming).
Card renderer must enforce layout constraints to avoid text overlap/clutter (defined sections and safe text areas).
Generation pipeline: prompt -> attribute detection (event/tone/theme/layout) -> content generation -> design generation -> 3 variations -> user edit/export.
Event-adaptive theme assets/decorations should be selected based on detected event type.

existing_features.title: Add a new creation mode called "Create Card With AI Prompt" that lets users enter a freeform natural-language prompt to generate a card/invitation, while keeping the existing quick form-based birthday generator as a separate "Quick Form Mode".
Implement a Prompt Mode input UI with a main textbox placeholder "Describe your card or invitation idea..." and a row/grid of clickable example prompts that prefill the textbox.

Create a prompt analysis step (rule-based, deterministic) that extracts and stores: event type, tone, visual theme keywords, and layout style from the user prompt, and display the detected values in the UI before/with the results.

Generate smart, structured card content from the prompt analysis output, including: (1) title/headline, (2) short readable main message, (3) signature/footer text, and ensure the content is sanitized to avoid instruction-like text.

Update the card export/preview text formatting logic so it is not hardcoded to birthdays (e.g., remove forced "Happy Birthday …" title) and instead uses the analyzed event type + tone to produce an appropriate title/headline and footer for multiple event types (Birthday, Wedding, Anniversary, Party, Corporate, Festival, Graduation, Baby Shower, Love cards).

Ensure Prompt Mode renders 3 unique card design variations per generation, with different layout compositions and different typography/color treatments, while obeying strict layout rules: Title section, decorative focus element, short message, footer branding; prevent text overlap/clutter.

Add event-adaptive visual theming so decorations and background/ornament choices change based on detected event type (Birthday → balloons/confetti/cake feel; Wedding → floral/gold/elegant ornaments; Corporate → minimal/modern; Baby Shower → cute/pastel).
Add user edit controls for Prompt Mode results: edit generated text fields (title/message/footer), switch theme, change tone, and regenerate designs (keeping the prompt visible/editable).

Apply premium export rules to Prompt Mode downloads: Free users get limited-resolution export and/or watermark; Premium users get HD export and watermark removal, reusing the existing entitlements model.

Add UI placeholders for "Video invitation option" and "Voice message card option" in the premium area as Coming Soon items gated behind premium (do not implement real video/voice capture or playback).

Update the Output section copy and structure for Prompt Mode so it is not birthday-pack specific (e.g., replace headings like "Your Birthday Pack" with a neutral multi-event label when Prompt Mode is used), while preserving the existing birthday-pack presentation for Quick Form Mode.

new_feature_requests.summary: Add prompt-based card creation mode with a main natural-language prompt input ("Describe your card or invitation idea...") and example prompts
Implement AI prompt analysis to auto-detect event type, tone, visual theme, layout style, and message format
Generate smart card content: professional message, structured text hierarchy, short readable message, and signature/footer
Generate professional card designs following strict layout rules (title, decorative focus element, short emotional message, footer branding) and prevent text overlap/clutter
Output 3 unique design variations per prompt with different compositions, typography, and color treatments
Support multiple card types/events beyond birthdays (wedding, anniversary, party, baby shower, corporate, festival, etc.) with event-adaptive themes/decorations
Add user edit controls: edit generated text, switch themes, change tone, and regenerate design
Add premium upgrade system: free vs premium exports (watermark/limited resolution vs HD export), plus extra templates and optional video invitation/voice message card options
Keep both creation modes: Quick Form Mode and Prompt Mode, with UI labeling like "Create Card With AI Prompt"
